title: Does you like mage supports?
body:
I main {{champion:143}} , and sometimes I get a surprising amount of anger from the enemy team calling Zyra a "fake" support, even if I still have an {{item:2301}} , {{item:2049}} , {{item:2043}} , {{item:3364}} , or {{item:3092}} . I understand that Zyra does a ridiculous amount of damage on such a low gold income and what not, but I still bring massive amounts of cc to my team, especially with 
{{item:3116}} . She can also supplement her teams damage or even do as much as an AP carry, which people seem to hate the most

What do you think about mage supports?


EDIT-TYPOS INTENSIFY

If you kill them quickly enough, they don't matter.

Also most of them have great cc. And I consider karma a support, one with stupidly incredible base damage. As a support main there are lots of times I do mage support to spice up my play pool.

maybe laning phase you can do that. but most are smart enough to play back and farm out the lane and not try to do all ins vs an "ap mage kill lane support" and if i see that type of support picked ill just pick a support that can heal their damage and poke back... hmm like {{champion:37}} {{champion:267}} or ill pick a  tank support with hard engage and run {{summoner:14}} and go ham to force them to play back or die. like {{champion:89}} . 
their cc isnt as reliable as some other supports and none of them provide a heal. the two im ok with as an adc is {{champion:143}} {{champion:26}} with zyra you have some cc and poke and a good disengage if someone tries to go all in or dives. an as far a zil is concerned he can buff my experience and bring me back from the dead. 

{{champion:1}} has a stun which is nice but she is offensively aggressive and not to much of a threat til 6. then she has only her stun and her ult that is effective to help. 
{{champion:63}} is damage. your more likely to lose out on kills with a brand due to his dot. he has good burst but cant hard cc on a reliable basis and provides no def play to peel or tank for adc. 
{{champion:9}} has his silence/poke and his fear to cc some. the best thing about him is ult but he is usually so far behind in gold he cant safely ult due to lack of core items for an ap champ
{{champion:99}} has a shield and an aoe slow and a root if she hits it. but can be easily dodged. she is about burst and majority of lux supports will flat out skip a SS for damage. when she dont need to carry. she can provide some decent utility but best suited for ap carry mid. 
also majority of people who go lux support picked mid/fill and got support so they pick lux to still try to be the "ap carry" as a support. 
{{champion:45}} has burst and his event horizon that if he lands can provide a stun but with out him taking cs he lacks damage and burst and doesnt provide any buffs/shields/heals ect at all. no def capabilities 
{{champion:161}} has good poke and damage , cc sometimes is difficult to land. similar to lux with damage and burst best suited mid. 

issue is most mage support will not get {{item:2049}} or other items to help team such as {{item:3050}} {{item:3222}} {{item:3190}} {{item:3060}} {{item:3105}} hell even a mage that has some kind of shield a {{item:3504}} or {{item:3174}} could be useful. 

also to pick these type of supports when your team has no hard reliable cc, a tank or someone to engage when typically top lane is a melee fighter/carry now , jungle may of may not go tankish/cc type but common picked junglers would suggest otherwise , more damage oriented.
mid lane is gonna go damage carry as well. and then your adc is left with zero peel , cc, heals, buffs, or shields. majority of adcs have no mobility and required protection in team fights and through out laning phase to scale and get items so late game they can be a high damage adc. majority of these ap mage supports dont provide that for an adc. however i will agree that if you can burst and get kills and snowball you have that advantage but if the enemy dont make a mistake and you cant snowball then your team comp is compromised.

If you are good, ap bot can be pretty threatening, that is only if you are great at that champ and could do all the things you set out to do. The goal between picking sona/nami and other supports botlane and picking Ap support bot is different. One looks to sustain, and to "grow" your adc, with a mage sup, you are just hoping to maim the enemy enough that they either feed or fall behind. If I'm Annie, my goal probably isn't to peel for my adc, I won't have to, because I'm suppose to get stuns off that set off kills for the adc, or poke the enemy adc into submission. But in most situations I will have or at least be close to having my stun so I could possibly give my adc a few seconds to do whatever he/she needs to do.

Now you are gonna say, what if they don't land the cc?

To that I'm going to say it's a matter of skill for the person playing it, you can say any number of the cc those champs have are hard to land (except Annie, her stun is stupidly easy to land) I can be a horrendous player who sucks at skillshots, if so, what is the different between nami and someone like Vel'koz? Not much, except maybe an ult that I can't fire off at the right time for nami and if it gets late enough, a heal might not matter as much as a missed stun. Regardless, the most important part of the equation is that you do what you are suppose to. 

Obviously, since mages are not built for support, to play them correctly for bot is hard, and requires a lot of skill. I can respect someone who could wreck their enemy and still have restraint to build like a support. But they are not terrible picks. Sometimes it's fun to take not traditional adcs and supports bot, and a lot of it also depends on the synergy between support and adc. 

That aside, my adoration for soraka makes me sad that you don't enjoy her. She's quite squishy and all, but she's rather useful, and the silence is nothing to sneeze at if you use it at the right times.

And Zilean... Idk why but in my mind he's always been a support, probably always will be too. Probably because I don't play him and therefore haven't managed to care about him.

hey we all have our own play styles. i would be considered a support main. and my 4 main supports are {{champion:37}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:89}} {{champion:111}} but i still like to play {{champion:54}} {{champion:57}} {{champion:20}} {{champion:3}} as off meta type of supports. but i always pick according to team comps. my team and enemies. i have also used some mage supports as well. {{champion:115}} can be a hand full for enemy team cuz of your poke and range, you have an aoe slow and a knock back kinda and his aoe ult does lot of damage. but my goal as a support is to be the type of protector enhancer for the adc while providing utility my team might lack. i have played {{champion:12}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:22}} {{champion:432}} {{champion:53}} {{champion:201}} {{champion:79}} {{champion:40}} {{champion:117}} {{champion:267}} {{champion:75}} {{champion:58}} {{champion:98}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:16}} {{champion:223}} {{champion:44}} {{champion:17}} {{champion:412}} {{champion:48}} {{champion:106}} {{champion:83}}  as well all at as supports. but when im playing adc i like the sustain/cc/peel type of supports cuz i need that for me to be a successful adc. i also dont play mid so maybe i lack some fundamentals on the so called "mage supports" from just pure lack of playing those champs.

I agree. Since me and my friends go some pretty whacky bot lanes, I don't really see problems with mage supports (some of which are honestly tamer then the crap we've done)

My top supports are Sona, Nami, Soraka and Lulu, I also play the occasional Karma and Leona, and one or two times have tried a few mage supports. Honestly, I play mage supports for fun mostly and usually go back to sustain supports for safety not because I don't find them viable but because of the fact that I generally am not as good with them/ not as familiar. 

But I find that if you do play mage support, you must save all cc until either your adc chooses to engage or you need it for peel. Besides that, it's also a matter of suiting what your adc wants. One of my friends sometimes prefer me going full damage and even ask me not to build sightstone (I disregard that one) while the other simply doesn't care as long as I am willing to go in with him and help him secure a kill or two. 

So I guess the point is that what support works and what doesn't purely depend on what your adc expects from you, after all you are sort of your adc's fairy godmother xD

Do I like mage supports? hell yeah
{{champion:117}} {{champion:37}} {{champion:117}} {{champion:267}} {{champion:117}} are all awesome
Why does it matter what the enemy team thinks of your champion or build choice?  Most of them are probably just mad that the support can 1v1 their carries.

ADC/Support main here, so I may be a bit bias.  I personally don't care what my support is, so long as they actually do something during the game.  Having a Janna that stands 10 feet behind me and randomly drops a shield on me is way worse, in my opinion, than having a mage support that is actually trying to harass the enemy without much peel.  I don't mind playing passively, but if all my support is doing is leeching experience without contributing to the lane, I'd rather they just play Soraka so they can at least heal me up from all the poke I'm trying to dodge.

To be fair, if you are building something like {{item:3092}} {{item:2045}} {{item:3116}} {{item:3151}} {{item:3020}} {{item:3135}} or {{item:2301}} {{item:3165}} {{item:3116}} {{item:3151}} {{item:3020}} {{item:3157}} , then you technically aren't a typical support in my opinion, you are an underfed midlaner.  Yeah, death is the best CC, but having {{item:3190}} {{item:3060}}  {{item:3050}} {{item:3110}} {{item:3222}} {{item:3512}} {{item:3504}} {{item:3174}} is being more of a support cause you are buying items to help your teammates.  Obviously there is a time and place to buy these items (zyra with athene's is kinda worthless without a locket for example), but so many supports forget that you are suppose to help your team.  Dealing damage is just a bonus late game.  Your ADC should be doing 90% of the damage late and you should be protecting them.  I'll still call you a support if you have 1 or 2 AP items that synergize with your kit.  But when you have 4 AP items, magic pen boots, and a sight stones and saying you're a support, that's like saying the top laner with {{item:3078}} {{item:3053}} {{item:3074}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3047}} {{item:3143}} is full tank.

Zyra main here myself (200K + mastery points).  My position is that there are some mages that are best suited for support, because they're terrible in 1v1 midlane scenarios.  Zyra, Annie, and Brand are all champions I believe due to lack of reliable CC/escapes work best with a partner.  And they're not bad because they're mages with 1 support item either - the support is there to provide a utility, and high damage/aoe stuns and knockups fits that description.

Though that's the good thing about the rise of the damage creep; these guys CAN get punished for simply being a "mage support" because eat a headshot or two, pop goes their health bars; which is an actual tradeoff.

If anything, most people I came across *loathes* them, especially ADCs. They usually starve the living shit out of their ADCs, then proceed to be shit later due to not having the typical mage build, and then become dead weight for the team. If I'm the midlaner playing an actual mage, I'd hate them because that's exactly what they're gonna do: starve their teammates by taking lots of kills, and then wonders why half their team are "useless".

Even under all that circumstances people are still heavily biased towards them. Very funny.
